title: Review & setlist: At Roadrunner, Wet Leg must have been kidding. Or maybe not?
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Concert Reviews Regardless, the up-and-coming alt rockers showed a devastating confidence during their second trip to Boston.
Rhian Teasdale brought her band Wet Leg, here at this past summer's Glastonbury Festival in the UK, to Roadrunner Sunday.
Leon Neal/Getty Images By Marc Hirsh September 15, 2025 | 1:05 PM 3 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: USA Today just named the 10 best supermarket chains — and none of them are Market Basket
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News "There are hundreds of grocery store chains across the United States, but some of them are more beloved than others.
" Customers leave an Aldi supermarket in 2024.
Bloomberg USA Today’s recently announced list of the 10 best supermarket chains didn’t include notable New England favorites such as Market Basket.

title: Mass. district suspends 2nd educator over Charlie Kirk comments
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News Overall, at least three school districts in the state are reviewing social media posts from employees following Kirk's public assassination.
People hold candles and sing during a memorial and prayer vigil for Charlie Kirk at the John F.
Kennedy Memorial Center for the Performing Arts, Sunday, Sept.

title: Revolution fire head coach Caleb Porter
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution New England suffered losing seasons in both years of Porter's tenure.
The Revolution announced on Monday that it had "parted ways" with head coach Caleb Porter.
Maddie Meyer/Getty Images By Hayden Bird September 15, 2025 | 12:33 PM 1 minute to read Caleb Porter is out as head coach of the Revolution.

title: Great Scott eyes 2027 reopening after go-ahead from Boston’s zoning board
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News After being rescheduled from July, the Great Scott plan passed the Zoning Board of Appeals last week.
Allston Live Management LLC ShareSend this article to your social connections.
Fans of Great Scott showed up strong for the music venue’s redevelopment plans at last Tuesday’s meeting of the Boston Zoning Board of Appeal.

title: Boston Sports Club members will share in nearly $4 million restitution payment
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Business The former CEO has been ordered to pay up after charging members when the gyms were closed in April 2020.
The Boston Sports Club in Somerville's Davis Square in July 2020.
Craig F.

title: Patriots share video of Mike Vrabel’s postgame speech after receiving game ball from Robert Kraft
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update "I'm proud to be your coach," Vrabel concluded.
"It's always about the team.
" Mike Vrabel and the Patriots during the team's win over the Dolphins in Miami.

title: 2 South Shore beaches closed after white shark-seal ‘interaction’
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News A photo shared by Plymouth police on Facebook showed the aftermath of the attack off of Manomet Point.
By Madison Lucchesi September 15, 2025 | 9:54 AM Less than a minute to read 1Share ShareSend this article to your social connections.
Two Plymouth beaches are closed after a white shark attacked a seal, police said.

title: Mike Vrabel critiqued NFL replay review and joked about his sideline sprint after first Patriots’ win
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patriots "Hopefully, this trend of these linemen false starting and then patting each other on the back after the game can end.

title: What is Marshmallow Fluff? A guide to the iconic New England spread.

bullets: Wickedpedia From its invention in Somerville to the Fluffernutter craze, here’s everything to know about the sticky-sweet New England staple.
